channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Nato backs US President Joe Biden after 'slip of tongue' at summit
item.description: NATO defended US President Joe Biden after he mistakenly referred to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as "President Putin" during a press conference at the NATO summit in Washington. The slip was quickly corrected, but reporters raised concerns. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and French President Emmanuel Macron both defended Biden, calling it a "slip of the tongue" and emphasising Biden’s clarity on issues. UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Polish President Andrzej Duda also expressed confidence in Biden’s leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'For the sake of American democracy': Who are 17 Democrats asking Biden to drop out of presidency race?
item.description: House Intelligence Committee's top Democrat, Jim Himes, advises President Biden to halt his 2024 re-election campaign amidst concerns over his legacy. Despite calls from 15 House Democrats, Biden has the backing of party leaders Jeffries and Schumer.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pew Survey: Trump leads Biden by 4 points in new poll amid concerns over President's mental acuity
item.description: A Pew Research Centre poll shows former President Trump leading President Biden by 4 points among registered voters, with 50% support to Biden's 47%. Only 24% of Americans view Biden as "mentally sharp," down from 54% in 2021, while 58% see Trump as sharp. Despite Biden being seen as more honest, Trump is perceived as more "mean-spirited."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Bet on Russia as a reliable partner is not a good bet': US warns India
item.description: US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan warned India that relying on Russia as a "reliable partner" is a poor strategic move, noting that Russia will prioritise its relationship with China over India in any future disputes. Sullivan, addressing questions about Prime Minister Modi's recent visit to Moscow, emphasized that while India’s long-standing ties with Russia persist, the US is focused on strengthening democratic partnerships globally. Modi’s visit to Russia was part of the 22nd India-Russia annual summit, amid the Ukraine conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If my doctors tell...': What Biden said on undergoing neurological examination
item.description: President Biden expressed willingness to undergo a neurological exam if recommended by his doctors, amid concerns about his mental fitness. He emphasised his doctors' competence and noted frustration over the focus on his age. Biden reaffirmed his re-election bid, despite Democratic pressure to withdraw, citing his extensive travel and decision-making as proof of his capabilities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Biden refers to Kamala Harris as 'vice president Trump' in solo press conference
item.description: ​​The president said, "Look, I wouldn't have picked vice president Trump to be vice president [if] I think she's not qualified to be president," confusing Harris with former president, Donald Trump. Earlier, during a Nato event, before the press conference, Biden mistakenly even referred to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as "President Putin". "And now I want to hand it over to the president of Ukraine, who has as much courage as he has determination, ladies and gentlemen, President Putin," Biden said at the Nato summit in Washington on July 10.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry receives ESPY award amid controversy
item.description: Prince Harry received the prestigious Pat Tillman honour at the ESPY Awards amidst initial criticism from Pat Tillman's mother, Mary. Despite controversy, Harry acknowledged Mary Tillman's advocacy for her son's legacy. Honored for founding the Invictus Games, he emphasized the award's significance to wounded service members. The event also celebrated A'ja Wilson and JuJu Watkins among other athletes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US to resume sending shipments of 500-pound bombs to Israel
item.description: The United States is resuming the shipment of 500-pound bombs to Israel after concerns about the use of 2,000-pound munitions in populated areas. President Biden confirmed that the larger bombs will not be sent. The conflict between Israel and Hamas has led to a significant civilian death toll and ongoing tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Giorgia Meloni rolls eyes, checks non-existent wrist watch as Biden is late
item.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni was caught rolling her eyes as she was speaking with Finnish president Alexander Stubb. The video of Meloni crossing her eyes and showing her wrist implying that she wasn't wearing a watch went viral. The other leaders she was engaged in a conversation checked the time -- indicating that Meloni's disgust was the delay by US president Joe Biden at the Nao summit earlier Thursday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Trump behind militia of 75 armed citizen in New York?
item.description: An ally of Donald Trump, Republican Bruce Blakeman is calling for 75 citizens with gun permits who have an interest in becoming "provisional emergency special duty sheriffs". The advertisement was posted in March and 25 people have already been trained. But what is this armed group and who is behind? The training of this new force has drawn criticism in the Long Island County which is considered as one of safest in the country and has a large police departments.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden's 'big boy' press conference deferred by an hour; 'Past his bedtime'
item.description: Joe Biden's first solo press conference later today which the White House billed as the 'big boy' address has been deferred by an hour. According to reports, the adjustment was due to Nato schedule and now be held at 6.30pm instead of 5.30. Donald Trump Jr mocked the rescheduling and said now it has moved past his bed time.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Biden has more stamina than George Clooney. Proof is...'
item.description: After George Clooney's hell-raising attack on President Joe Biden in an opinion piece in New York Times where he said Biden should opt out of the race as he is no more the Biden of 2020, a Biden aide said the president has more stamina than at least the Hollywood actor. 63-year-old Clooney left the fundraiser three hours before the President, the same fundraiser that Clooney held three weeks ago and based his opinion piece on his interaction with Biden there.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Court in Japan allows transgender woman to officially change gender without compulsory surgery
item.description: Japanese high court permits transgender woman to change her gender without surgery, addressing economic burdens and equal rights protections. Hormonal therapy sufficed, with the Supreme Court earlier ruling sterilization unconstitutional. Although non-binding, this ruling marks progress for transgender females. Some questions about hormone access remain. The claimant expressed relief at this landmark decision.

item.title: US inflation broadly cools, likely sealing deal for fed rate cut
Biden's moment of reckoning in unscripted press conference today
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: 6.5 magnitude earthquake jolts Canada
item.description: Canada earthquake: The epicenter of the quake was around 130 miles from Tofino, a small district on Vancouver Island in the Pacific Ocean off Canada's west coast, according to the US Geological Survey. Tofino is around 130 miles west of Vancouver.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barron Trump has father's grin: Body language expert on his first rally appearance
item.description: Barron Trump's confidence showed that he accepted his father's audience as his audience which also showed potential aspiration -- not just loyalty, body language expert Judi James said noting that he was clearing enjoying the adulation that he received at his first appearance in a political campaign rally. His grin is like his father's and his thumbs-up was also very Trump-like, the expert noted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Mass stranding' of more than 70 pilot whales in Scotland
item.description: Scores of whales washed ashore in a "mass stranding" in Scotland's Orkney archipelago on Thursday, a British marine life rescue charity said. A total of 77 long-finned pilot whales were found on the island of Sanday in Orkney, off the northeastern coast of Scotland, after the British Divers Marine Life Rescue (BDMLR) received a report.

item.title: A stegosaurus nicknamed Apex will be auctioned in New York, remains showed signs of arthritis
item.description: The nearly complete fossilized remains of Apex, a 161-million-year-old stegosaurus, will be auctioned by Sotheby's in New York next week. Discovered in Colorado in 2022, Apex stands 11 feet tall and 27 feet long. Sotheby's estimates the sale at $4-6 million, highlighting Apex's advanced age and unique features as part of their "Geek Week" series.

item.title: Britain's King Charles III and Queen Camilla visit Wales, see pics
